definition: to acknowledge/to respond/to answer/to pay attention/to heed/to deal with
to answer/to agree
reply/answer/return/respond/echo
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to pay no heed to

sentences.english: The manager will not look at a report like that.
sentences.chinese: 经理不会答理那样一份报告。

sentences.english: A spasm of anguish shot through her, and she returned him no answer.
sentences.chinese: 她不禁痛苦得全身一阵痉挛，没有答理他的话。

sentences.english: He didn't even return my greeting.
He would speak to nobody when he was in full tilt.
sentences.chinese: 全身伏在马背时，他谁也不答理。

sentences.english: He said hello to me, but I didn't acknowledge him.
sentences.chinese: 他跟我打招呼，我没答理他。

sentences.english: Still no answer came from Tess.
Cthe prove to best hear me cwoulsl ?
But the minister's son made no reply.
sentences.chinese: 但大臣的儿子没有答理她。

definition: variant of 答理[da1 li5]
to heed/to pay attention to
variant of 睬[cai3]
to pay attention/to take notice of/to care for
to answer/to respond/to converse
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
not to pay attention to/to leave sth as it is/to ignore
variant of 不答理[bu4 da1 li3]
to refuse to acknowledge/to pay no attention to/to take no notice of/to ignore
to utter a sound
to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to answer/to respond/to converse
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
to speak/to emit sound
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
to respond
